SECRET.
BATTLE SITUATION - EVENING - JULY 28th, 1918.
1. WESTERN FRONT.
(a)French Front. In CHAMPAGNE, to tho East of RHEIMS, the enemy heavily bombarded the ground taken by the French South of MONT-SANS-NOM, and North-East of ST. HILAIRE, and followed the bombardment by infantry attacks, which were repulsed. From RHEIMS to SOISSONS severe fighting continues, but except South-West of RHEIMS, where the line is reported to run approximately East of BLIGNY - MONT de BLIGNY - North of JONQUERY - la MARQUERELLE North of PASSY GRIGNY, there is no change in the line as given in the noon battle situation. FERE-en-TARDENOIS and RONCHERES are both held by the enemy. Between the AISNE and MONTDIDIER there has been heavy enemy artillery fire.
(b) British Front. There is nothing to report.
2. ITALIAN AND MACEDONIAN FRONTS. There is no change in the situation.
General Staff,
War Office, S.W.1.
28th July, 1918.
Issued at 6.20 p.m.
